title: INTENSE Weight Gain Workout - OMG! 😱
description:
Learning how to gain weight fast if you're skinny is hard.INTENSE Weight Gain Workout - OMG! 😱

If you are a person that is struggling to gain weight this workout is for you. You don’t need any weights for this intense weight gain workout. 

If you are skinny there is nothing more frustrating than eating everything in sight and still not being able to gain weight. This video will help you gain weight even when working out at home. 


🙏 S U B S C R I B E (please lol)
👉 START NOW -  https://www.kobokofitness.com/
1️⃣ 21-Day Belly Fat Focus (BFF) Program - https://bit.ly/3pAETFu
2️⃣ 8-Week Booty Fix Program - https://bit.ly/3pDNebC
3️⃣ Jan - Dec Workout Schedule -   https://www.kobokofitness.com/
4️⃣ 30 DAY CHALLENGE -  https://www.kobokofitness.com/
5️⃣ ALL ACCESS PASS -  https://www.kobokofitness.com/

Coupon Codes
Booty Fix Program
COUPON CODE: SPECIAL

Belly Fat Focus (BFF) Program
COUPON CODE: BFF99

ALL ACCESS PASS (everything + Jan - Dec Workout Schedule)
COUPON CODE: KOKOPUFF

Learning how to gain weight fast if you're skinny is hard. For some people, weight gain is as painful as weight loss for others so I made this video specifically for most of us that struggle in gaining weight. 

If you're skinny and looking for exercises on how to gain weight or how to get big fast this weight gain workout at home can definitely help you. 

Most people can do this workout everyday with no problems but check with your doctor if you have any questions, concerns, or special circumstances.

Always warm up for 2-3 minutes before doing ANY workout. Here's a good multi-purpose warm up that most people can easily do. 
20 sec jumping jacks
20 sec squats
20 sec lunges
do twice

Be sure to consider the rest of your workout commitments as you decide which workouts to do. 20 - 30 min total per day is a good amount!

-------------------------
😃ABOUT KOBOKO 
------------------------
My name is Kola Olaosebikan. Mom to one delightful toddler and happily married :) I am a Certified Personal Trainer (CPT) trained by the American Council on Exercise and Stanford University. I am Nigerian AND American AND in love with pizza (no tomato sauce. thanks)

I love sharing fitness vlogs. The BEST at home workouts for women. Mostly bodyweight meaning you can complete my youtube workout videos with no equipment! My intention is to help you get your best body ever! 

You'll get
-Home workout without equipment
-Home workouts with minimal equipment (resistance bands and dumbbells)
-LOWERBODY WORKOUTS! haha
-Dance Workouts
And so much more!!
As an online trainer, I also love the random chances I get to actually MEET my Koko puffs (you) in person! 

Anyway, on this fitness channel, you'll find mainly workouts. All the workouts are fast and highly effective. They will help you with weight loss, flatter abs, strength, booty growth. I may also do reviews of fitness products from time to time but not very often.

comments:
It's my first day to workout. March 29.
Can someone like it, so i could remember this

I'm so tired of hearing people say "ohh you're too skinny" , "you should eat more" , " Are you still a kid?" And these comments coming from people i love. I feel insecure about my body . It's like i'm trapped in a 12 year body . I've been struggling with gaining weight and i eat right i'm also moderately active. I hope this workout turns out to be the winner for me . I really want to gain weight.

Been doing this exercise since 6th June, I didn't weight myself everyday though.
Day 1: 42.6kg
Day 14: 42.9kg (so yeah a small increase but I also blame myself for continuing the habit of keeping myself hungry)
Day 15: 43.3kg
Day 17: 43.6kg
Day 18: 43.3kg
Day 19: 44.0kg
Day 20: 44.2kg
Day 26: 43.7kg (I haven't been working out because I had pain in my left arm prior to getting vaccinated. I also ate a little less).
Day 27: 43.7kg
Day 28: 44.0kg
Day 29: 43.9kg
Day 30: 44.0kg
Day 31: 43.8kg
Day 32: 43.8kg
Day 33: 44.1kg
Day 34: 44.2kg
Day 36: 44.3kg
Day 37: 44.3kg
Day 38: 44.6kg
Day 40: 45.4kg
Day 41: 45.2kg
Day 42: 44.7kg
Day 43: 44.9kg
Day 44: 45.0kg
Day 45: 45.2kg
Day 46: 45.1kg
Day 47: 45.0kg
Day 48: 45.0kg
Day 49: 44.9kg
Day 50: 44.9kg
Day 52: 45.0kg
Day 60: 45.2kg
Day 61: 45.3kg
Day 65: 46.0kg (officially not underweight anymore)
Day 66: 45.5kg
Day 68: 45.7kg
Day 69: 45.8kg
Day 71: 46.3kg
Day 72: 46.2kg
Day 76: 46.4kg
Day 78: 46.5kg
Day 79: 46.3kg
Day 82: 46.4kg

My advice is to also eat more calories than you do. Slowly reach the target of eating 2,000 calories a day.

EDIT: By Halloween or Christmas (preferably halloween), I hope to reach 50kg. I'm only 5'2 but I want to be physically and will try to bulk up a little with the use of dumbbells.

EDIT 2: I have bought dumbbells and I hope to start using them on Day 84.

EDIT 3: I have started using dumbbells on Day 84 but I'm doing more of basic workout exercise FIRST with them so I won't be updating until I'm ready to use them for this workout on the video but thank you everyone for liking my comment and taking the time to look at it. I'll get back when I'm ready incorporate this intense workout with my dumbbells. (I'm starting with 3kg dumbbells).


EDIT 4: August 16th, 2022. I forgot about this comment lmaooo. I'm around 50kg and I'm no longer focused so much on my weight. I started Muay Thai in May 2022 and I'm going to the gym now in which I started a month ago. Deadlifting 20kg and bench press 5kg. Keep eating well and getting fit. The dedication actually helped me to love fitness and martial arts.
Finally something from a female fitness youtuber aimed for GAINING weight and not for LOSING it which is literally every damn video on youtube, thanks for this!!!
I love how she's not too serious or like a strict face, i love how she jokes around and it makes me laugh while doing the exercise. I kept failing but i won't give up <3
